content: I'd like to write a minimal reproduction for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/81883 but I'd need feature(staged_api) (apparently: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/81883#issuecomment-775383110). I tried some Googling and checked out the unstable book, but didn't find anything about how to use it. Is it documented anywhere? If not, can someone point me at some example usage?
It would be nice to add it to the unstable book
Technically it's there, just refuses to explain anything because it's internal to the compiler

hyd-dev said:

I'm not sure if this helps? https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=ab4b943d055d77e4fcb59dc1f9a669d2

Yes, that's great, thanks! Going to look into that tomorrow I think

@Dirkjan Ochtman The documentation for staged_api is at https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/stability.html#staged_api. I think it would be great to at least add a link in the unstable book to the rustc-dev-guide (I wish every chapter in the unstable book said something useful).

I realize that documentation for staged_api is pretty short, but hopefully the entire chapter gives a little more context on stability attributes and how they interact. The staged_api attribute really doesn't do much on its own, so there's not much to say about it.

If you have any questions not answered in that chapter, feel free to ask. I may be able to answer them, or if not try to figure it out. Or you can open a PR on the rustc-dev-guide if there's something you'd like to add.
Huh, I actually searched for "rustc dev guide staged_api", I think, and didn't find that
huh it's the first result for me image.png
I default to DuckDuckGo, which apparently doesn't do as well on this particular query
